meanings.sent1: She decided to renew her old friendship with a phone call.
meanings.sent2: Every spring, the flowers renew their bloom.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion promised to renew youth, but it just made her sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise seemed to renew the world with its golden light.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped renew the thirsty earth, bringing life to the dry soil.

meanings.definition: To resume an activity or process
meanings.sent1: After the break, they will renew their discussion on the project.
meanings.sent2: The team will renew their training sessions next week.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to renew its nap after being disturbed by a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The river will renew its flow after the dam is removed.
meanings.sent5: The students will renew their focus after the short recess.

meanings.definition: To extend the period of validity of something
meanings.sent1: She had to renew her driver's license before it expired.
meanings.sent2: The library allows you to renew borrowed books up to three times.
meanings.sent3: The wizard used a spell to renew the enchantment on the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent4: The software company offers an option to renew the subscription annually.
meanings.sent5: He quickly went online to renew his membership before it lapsed.
